ratings.comment: Don't buy the book! Easy exams, papers are what brought my grade down.  Really pick on how you cite your paper.  Easy to get an A/B or B but very few people get an A.  Go to lecture because she often says things that will be on the exam.  Very helpful and gives a lot of personal stories about the information.

Feisty woman, talks frankly and gives academically interesting anecdotes of her time in the clinic, but power lectures are intense (as are any), especially when she flies through power points. Often unclear what the reading assignments are, changed the calendar due to necessity, but fair grader on the paper assignments.

She was knowledgeable about her topic, and lectured well, but as a teacher she was inconsistent and frustrating. She would be late to class and miss class frequently without warning. Her review sessions for exams were too far ahead of the exam, so it was difficult to prepare, and towards the end of the semester she change our final to cumulative
waste of time coming to lecture; just print off slides. She only offers extra credit to those who score under 76% on exams, which sucks and she does have a stank attitude sometimes.
